ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I've grown tremendously as a filmmaker through the various videos that we created ourselves and analyzed throughout the semester. By taking this course, I've significantly grown my overall cultural competence and understanding of modern digital video.

Film techniques in framing, shooting, camera movement, editing, sound design.
Study of a wide array of films from different cultures to reveal a breadth of techniques of storytelling through video.
I learned how to shoot different shots, learned framing techniques, camera techniques, about camera settings, sound, and lighting.

Basic knowledge in creating digital videos, including framing, camera usage, editing and after effect software. More importantly, this course challenges your previous approach towards art and inspires you to fully open up your mindset and experiment with novel themes and methods.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I thoroughly enjoyed the flexibility that we were given in the topics of our films. While I loved the variety of video work we examined throughout the semester, I wonder if students' interests/suggestions could be incorporated in selecting these works.

Neil is a huge asset to this course. He is dedicated, insightful, knowledgable, and he allows you to incubate your own style for the videos you make, rather than making you adhere to any tradition.

I thought it was a really well-designed course and I wouldnt change anything.

Neil gives great feedback on every project you do and really wants to see you succeed. I really enjoyed our conversations brainstorming about my projects. I think the class could be improved with a more defined prompt for the final project or by opening up to the possibility of a group project. I think organizing shoot times, arranging for cameras, and setting up shots was very difficult alone and often very frustrating.

Strength: Neil is an amazing instructor who challenges your mindset, inspires you to create, and encourages you to push forward the boundary and experiment with the craziest ideas that you dare not try before. Every conversation I had with Neil was inspiring and enjoyable. I feel comfortable raising weird ideas and discussing anything with Neil because I know he will always be supportive and never hesitate to offer critical suggestions. I'm so happy that I took this course. I have zero experience with video arts before, but filming videos with Neil inspires me so much and helps a lot with my practices in drawing and design.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, 100%! I would recommend this course to anyone with a slight interest in filmmaking and video making. The class is a very enjoyable, welcoming, and enriching environment.
This class is a gem and you should definitely take it if you get the chance, even if you are not planning to major in film or art.
Yes, if you want to learn the basics of the filmmaking process, I think this course teaches many of the technical aspects to the best of its ability.
Yes absolutely! Neil is an amazing structor, the class is well-organized as an Art class and you will learn a new element in video art every week.
